job_description:
Purchase Ledger Clark
Location: Central London (near Edgware Road Tube), office-based, full-time (no remote or hybrid working)
Company Overview:
We are a dynamic and growing Publishing Sales Company based near Edgware Road Tube in Central London. Operating across two main trading companies, we offer a collaborative and fast-paced work environment. We are seeking a dedicated Finance Administrator/Purchase Ledger Clerk to join our team and support our financial operations.
Job Description: As a Finance Administrator/Purchase Ledger Clerk, you will ensure the accuracy of financial transactions and contribute to the financial health of the company. This role is perfect for someone detail-oriented and passionate about finance.
Key Responsibilities:
Process supplier invoices and credit notes with accuracy and proper authorisation.
Reconcile supplier statements and resolve discrepancies.
Prepare and process payment runs.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date purchase ledger records.
Assist with month-end close processes, including journal entries and account reconciliations.
Support the Head of Finance with various accounting tasks and projects.
Respond to supplier queries promptly and professionally.
Ensure compliance with company policies and accounting regulations.
Qualifications and Skills:
Experience in a similar role (Purchase Ledger Clerk, Accounts Payable, Finance Administrator).
Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial processes.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and accounting software, particularly QuickBooks and Sage.
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvement.
Self-discipline and a focused work ethic.
REQUIRED:
1) Ability to work legally in the UK
2) Relevant professional qualifications, such as AAT Level 2 (ideally 3) or higher.
3) Good written and spoken English to professional standard
4) Experience: Minimum of 2 years' work experience in a similar role.
Salary: £27,000 per year + bonus + exam support (AAT Level 3-4)
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: £27,000.00 per year
Additional pay:
Yearly bonus
Benefits:
Company events
Company pension
Free parking
On-site parking

Monday to Friday
